results.title: Paddington and the Christmas shopping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Christmas shopping is adapted from Chapter 6 of “More about Paddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington is on his way into the distinguished shop of Crunbold and Ferns but experiences trouble with the revolving doors. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington and the 'old master'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Old Master is adapted from Chapters 4,5, and 8 of “A Bear Called Padddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington learns from Mr Gruber, an antique dealer, that old master-pieces are sometimes covered by newer paintings and that the “old master” can be restored. Paddington decides to apply this technique to one of Mr Brown’s paintings with disastrous results. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington makes a clean sweep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mr and Mrs Brown decide to begin spring cleaning and buy a chimney sweeping outfit. While Mr and Mrs Brown go to the sales, Paddington decides to lend a helping paw by cleaning the chimney but encounters problems when the brush becomes detached in the chimney and when he attempts to retrieve it, his head becomes stuck in the chimney pot! Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: An Unexpected party
results.creator_credit: Michael Bond, Ivor Wood and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”
When word arrives that Paddington’s Aunt Lucy is celebrating her one-hundredth birthday, the Browns offer to send Paddington home to Lima to visit for the occasion. The Browns are afraid he will leave forever, but he assures them that he will return. Adapted from Chapter 7 from the book Paddington Marches On by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: Jack Marin: forward play. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jack Marin, one of the outstanding shooters in professional basketball, demonstrates the art of foul shooting, developing one “fluid motion”, proper rebounding strategies and tactics and offensive rebounding.
results.description:

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale demonstrates and describes how a player must “protect” the basket and box out his opponent from chasing his own rebound and get a “good position” from re-bounding. He goes over the fundamentals of team defence and individual defence.

results.title: Center play. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Willis Reed, star centre of the New York Knicks gives an impressive demonstration of the techniques of rebounding for centres, of blocking out, faking, switching on the “pick”, and proper training techniques. Filmed at Reed’s summer basketball camp.

results.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jo Jo White of the Boston Celtics demonstrates the proper ways to pass and dribble and thus establish the ball control capabilities demanded of a good defensive guard. The chest pass, bounce pass, 2-hand overhead pass, hook pass, baseball pass, dribbling techniques and moving without the ball are all shown.
results.description:

group_siblings.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 1

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale of the Phoenix Suns is a rare “four-way” player - equally good at both defense and offense and at ease both as a forward or a guard. In this film, Van Arsdale concentrates on the elements of defense at which he is so outstanding. He shows how a player must learn to position his feet and use his hands properly, shows how to fight over a “pick” and switch on a “screen”.
